data.enText: to combine or make two or more things combine to form a single thing

data.chText: 这几家银行准备明年合并。
data.enText: The banks are set to merge next year.

data.chText: 他的部门将和我的合并。
data.enText: His department will merge with mine.

data.chText: 这些村庄扩大了并且结合成了一个大集镇。
data.enText: The villages expanded and merged into one large town.

data.chText: 在他最近的惊险小说中，真实和虚构交织在一起。
data.enText: Fact and fiction merge together in his latest thriller.

data.chText: 两大组织合并组成一个新党。
data.enText: The two groups have merged to form a new party.

data.chText: 他的部门将和我的合并。
data.enText: His department will be merged with mine.

data.chText: 公司是由三家小公司合并组成的。
data.enText: The company was formed by merging three smaller firms.

data.chText: 相融；融入；渐渐消失在某物中
data.enText: if two things merge , or if one thing merges into another, the differences between them gradually disappear so that it is impossible to separate them

data.chText: 山峦渐渐隐入背后漆黑的夜空之中。
data.enText: The hills merged into the dark sky behind them.

data.chText: 悄悄融入整体；不求闻达
data.enText: to behave quietly when you are with a group of people so that they do not notice you

simple_means.memory_skill: merg 沉，没 + e → 沉下 → 融为一体 → 合并

data.chText: 悄悄融入整体；不求闻达
data.enText: to behave quietly when you are with a group of people so that they do not notice you

value.def: If one thing merges with another, or is merged with another, they combine or come together to make one whole thing. You can also say that two things merge, or are merged .

example.tran: 我和他的生活合而为一。

example.ex: Bank of America merged with a rival bank...
example.tran: 美国银行与一家竞争银行合并了。

example.ex: The rivers merge just north of a vital irrigation system...
example.tran: 就在一个重要的灌溉系统的北边，这些河流交汇在一起。

example.ex: The two countries merged into one...
He sees sense in merging the two agencies while both are new...
example.tran: 他觉得将这两家建立不久的机构合而为一是明智的。

example.ex: Then he showed me how to merge the graphic with text on the same screen.
example.tran: 然后他教我如何将图表和文字合并在同一个屏幕上。

value.def: If one sound, colour, or object merges into another, the first changes so gradually into the second that you do not notice the change.

example.ex: Like a chameleon, he could merge unobtrusively into the background...
example.tran: 他就像一条变色龙，可以神不知鬼不觉地隐藏在背景中间。

example.ex: His features merged with the darkness...
example.tran: 他的面容消失在黑暗之中。

example.ex: Night and day begin to merge.

partsOfSpeech.dec: e 出 + merg 沉，没 + e → 水落石出 → 浮现
e 出 + merg 沉，没 + ency 表行为 →〔突然〕出现 → 突发事件
e 出 + mers 沉，没 + ion 表名词 → 沉下又出现 → 浮现
im 进入 + merg 沉，没 + e → 浸没
im 进入 + mers 沉，没 + e → 沉进去 → 沉浸
merg 沉，没 + e → 沉下 → 融为一体 → 合并
sub 下 + merg 沉，没 + e → 沉下去 → 沉没
sub 下 + mers 沉，没 + ed 表形容词 → 沉到水下的 → 在水下的
